subject: Productivity
title: Standardizing Time Zones
description: A fast breakdown of Standardizing Time Zones for builders.

hook.text: In 1880, every American city set clocks by its own local sun. Trains crashed because of it.

buildup.text: Railroads needed consistent schedules. Different local times made coordination deadly.

discovery.text: In 1883, US railroads adopted four standard time zones. The government followed a year later.

twist.text: Sandford Fleming, a Canadian engineer, proposed worldwide time zones after missing a train in Ireland.

climax.text: Standardized time made modern logistics, communication, and business coordination possible.

punchline.text: Global time zones exist because of train crashes.

quiz.question: Why did the US adopt standard time zones in 1883?
options: Railroads needed consistent schedules to prevent crashes
The government wanted to control citizens' sleep
Farmers demanded it for harvest coordination
